refentry.refsect1: Stability Level Stable, unless otherwise indicated

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: OsmGpsMap is a widget for displaying a map, optionally overlaid with a track(s) of GPS co-ordinates, images, points of interest or on screen display controls. OsmGpsMap downloads (and caches for offline use) map data from a number of websites, including

example.title: Showing a map

refsect1.para: OsmGpsMap allows great flexibility in customizing how the map tiles are cached, see “tile-cache-base” and “tile-cache” for more information.

A number of different map sources are supported, see OsmGpsMapSource_t. The default source, OSM_GPS_MAP_SOURCE_OPENSTREETMAP always works. Other sources, particular those from proprietary providers may work occasionally, and then cease to work. To check if a source is supported for the given version of this library, call osm_gps_map_source_is_valid().

example.title: Map with custom source and cache dir

refsect1.para: Finally, if you wish to use a custom map source not supported by OsmGpsMap, such as a custom map created with
then you can also pass a specially formatted string to “repo-uri”.

example.title: Map using custom CloudMade map and on screen display

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the default cache directory for the library, that is the base directory to which the full cache path is appended. If “tile-cache-base” is omitted from the constructor then this value is used.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_new ()
refsect2.para: Returns a new OsmGpsMap object, defaults to showing data from
See the properties description for more information about construction parameters than could be passed to g_object_new()

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_download_maps ()
refsect2.programlisting: void osm_gps_map_download_maps (OsmGpsMap *map, OsmGpsMapPoint *pt1, OsmGpsMapPoint *pt2, int zoom_start, int zoom_end);
refsect2.para: Downloads all tiles over the supplied zoom range in the rectangular region specified by pt1 (north west corner) to pt2 (south east corner)

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_download_cancel_all ()
refsect2.para: Cancels all tiles currently being downloaded. Typically used if you wish to cacel a large number of tiles queued using osm_gps_map_download_maps()

entry.para: point to be filled with the top left location.
point to be filled with the bottom right location.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_set_center ()
refsect2.programlisting: void osm_gps_map_set_center (OsmGpsMap *map, float latitude, float longitude);

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_set_center_and_zoom ()
refsect2.programlisting: void osm_gps_map_set_center_and_zoom (OsmGpsMap *map, float latitude, float longitude, int zoom);

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_scroll ()
refsect2.programlisting: void osm_gps_map_scroll (OsmGpsMap *map, gint dx, gint dy);
refsect2.para: Scrolls the map by dx , dy pixels (positive north, east)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the scale of the map at the center, in meters/pixel.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_set_keyboard_shortcut ()
refsect2.programlisting: void osm_gps_map_set_keyboard_shortcut (OsmGpsMap *map, OsmGpsMapKey_t key, guint keyval);
refsect2.para:
Associates a keyboard shortcut with the supplied keyval
(as returned by gdk_keyval_from_name or simiar). The action given in key
will be triggered when the corresponding keyval is pressed. By default no keyboard shortcuts are associated.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_get_event_location ()
refsect2.para: A convenience function for getting the geographic location of events, such as mouse clicks, on the map

entry.para: A GtkEventButton that occured on the map

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The point on the globe corresponding to the click.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_convert_geographic_to_screen ()
refsect2.para: Convert the given location on the globe to the corresponding pixel locations on the map.

entry.para: pixel location on map, x axis.
pixel location on map, y axis.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_convert_screen_to_geographic ()
refsect2.programlisting: void osm_gps_map_convert_screen_to_geographic (OsmGpsMap *map, gint pixel_x, gint pixel_y, OsmGpsMapPoint *pt);
refsect2.para: Convert the given pixel location on the map into corresponding location on the globe

entry.para: pixel location on map, x axis
pixel location on map, y axis

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_gps_add ()
refsect2.programlisting: void osm_gps_map_gps_add (OsmGpsMap *map, float latitude, float longitude, float heading);

entry.para: degrees or OSM_GPS_MAP_INVALID to disable showing heading

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The OsmGpsMapTrack of the internal GPS track, i.e. that which is modified when calling osm_gps_map_gps_add(). You must not free this.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_image_add ()
refsect2.programlisting: OsmGpsMapImage * osm_gps_map_image_add (OsmGpsMap *map, float latitude, float longitude, GdkPixbuf *image);

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A OsmGpsMapImage representing the added pixbuf.

refsect2.title: osm_gps_map_image_add_with_alignment ()
refsect2.programlisting: OsmGpsMapImage * osm_gps_map_image_add_with_alignment (OsmGpsMap *map, float latitude, float longitude, GdkPixbuf *image, float xalign, float yalign);

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: A OsmGpsMapImage representing the added pixbuf.

refsect2.title: struct OsmGpsMapClass

refsect1.title: Property Details

refsect2.title: The “auto-center-threshold” property
refsect2.para: the amount of the window the gps point must move before auto centering.

refsect2.title: The “drag-limit” property
refsect2.para: The number of pixels the user has to move the pointer in order to start dragging.

refsect2.title: The “gps-track-highlight-radius” property
refsect2.para: The radius of the gps point highlight circle.

refsect2.title: The “gps-track-point-radius” property
refsect2.para: The radius of the gps point inner circle.

refsect2.title: The “gps-track-width” property
refsect2.para: The width of the lines drawn for the gps track.

refsect2.title: The “image-format” property
refsect2.para: The map source tile repository image format (jpg, png).

refsect2.title: The “map-source” property
refsect2.para: A OsmGpsMapSource_t representing the tile repository to use

note.para: If you do not wish to use the default map tiles (provided by OpenStreeMap) it is recommened that you set this property at construction, instead of setting “repo-uri”.

refsect2.title: The “record-trip-history” property
refsect2.para: should all gps points be recorded in a trip history.

refsect2.title: The “repo-uri” property
refsect2.para: A URI string which defines the location and format to fetch tiles for the map. The string is of the format "http://tile.openstreetmap.org/#Z/#X/#Y.png". Characters that begin with # are treated as tokens and replaced according to the following rules;

listitem.para: #Y - Y-tile, slippy map format, mercator projection
#Z - Zoom level, where min_zoom >= zoom <= max_zoom

note.para: If you do not wish to use the default map tiles (provided by OpenStreeMap) it is recommened that you use one of the predefined map sources, and thus you should construct the map by setting “map-source” and not “repo-uri”. The “repo-uri” property is primarily designed for applications that wish complete control of tile repository management, or wish to use OsmGpsMap with a tile repository it does not explicitly support.

refsect2.title: The “show-gps-point” property
refsect2.para: Controls whether the current gps point is shown on the map. Note that for derived classes that implement the draw_gps_point vfunc, if this property is FALSE

refsect2.title: The “show-trip-history” property
refsect2.para: should the recorded trip history be shown on the map.

refsect2.title: The “tile-cache” property
refsect2.para: Either a full path or one of the special format URIs OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_DISABLED, OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_AUTO, OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_FRIENDLY. Also see “tile-cache-base” for a full understanding.

OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_DISABLED disables the on disk tile cache (so all tiles are fetched from the network. OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_AUTO causes the tile cache to be /tile-cache-base/md5(repo-uri), where md5 is the md5sum of “repo-uri”. OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_FRIENDLY causes the tile cache to be /tile-cache-base/friendlyname(repo-uri).
Any other string is interpreted as a local path, i.e. /path/to/cache

refsect1.refsect2:
The “tile-cache-base” property OsmGpsMap:tile-cache-base “tile-cache-base” gchar *
The base directory of the tile cache when you have constructed the map with “tile-cache” set to OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_AUTO or OSM_GPS_MAP_CACHE_FRIENDLY
The string is interpreted as a local path, i.e. /path/to/cache. If NULL is supplied, map tiles are cached starting in the users cache directory, (as outlined in the
XDG Base Directory Specification). To get the
base directory where map tiles will be cached call osm_gps_map_get_default_cache_directory()
Flags: Read / Write / Construct Only
Default value: NULL

refsect2.title: The “tile-zoom-offset” property
refsect2.para: Number of zoom-levels to upsample tiles.

refsect2.title: The “tiles-queued” property
refsect2.para: The number of tiles currently waiting to download. Connect to ::notify::tiles-queued if you want to be informed when this changes

refsect2.title: The “zoom” property
refsect2.para: The map zoom level. Connect to ::notify::zoom if you want to be informed when this changes.

refsect2.title: The “changed” signal
refsect2.para: The “changed” signal is emitted any time the map zoom or map center is chaged (such as by dragging or zooming).

note.para: If you are only interested in the map zoom, then you can simply connect to ::notify::zoom

entry.simpara: user data set when the signal handler was connected.
